arguments.data: data for the element that was clicked
arguments.i: the index of the data in the set

mouseover.desc: Callback behavior for a user mousing over a data point.

arguments.data: data for the element that was clicked
arguments.i: the index of the data in the set

mouseout.desc: Callback behavior for a user mousing off a data point.

arguments.data: data for the element that was clicked
arguments.i: the index of the data in the set

click.desc: Callback behavior for a user clicking a data point.

axisPaddingTop.desc: Amount of space between the top of the chart and the top value on the y-scale.

axisPaddingRight.desc: Amount of space between the right side of the chart and the highest value on the x-scale.

axisPaddingBottom.desc: Amount of space between the bottom of the chart and the lowest value on the y-scale.

axisPaddingLeft.desc: Amount of space between the left side of the chart and the lowest value on the x-scale.

xMin.desc: Minimum allowed value on the xScale. If null, uses the data's min value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales. May be overrided using the setData method with the xMin data format key.

xMax.desc: Maximum allowed value on the xScale. If null, uses the data's max value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales. May be overrided using the setData method with the xMax data format key.

yMin.desc: Minimum allowed value on the yScale. If null, uses the data's min value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales. May be overrided using the setData method with the yMin data format key.

yMax.desc: Maximum allowed value on the yScale. If null, uses the data's max value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales. May be overrided using the setData method with the yMax data format key.

paddingTop.desc: Amount of space from the top edge of the svg element to the beginning of the <var>axisPaddingTop</var>.

paddingRight.desc: Amount of space from the right edge of the svg element to the beginning of the <var>axisPaddingRight</var>.

paddingBottom.desc: Allows space for the x-axis scale. Controls the amount of space from the bottom edge of the svg element to the beginning of the <var>axisPaddingBottom</var>.

paddingLeft.desc: Allows space for the y-axis scale. Amount of space from the left edge of the svg element to the beginning of the <var>axisPaddingLeft</var>.

tickHintX.desc: The amount of ticks that you would like to have displayed on the x-axis. Note: this is merely a guide and your results will likely vary.

tickFormatX.desc: Provide alternate formatting for the x-axis tick labels.

tickHintY.desc: The amount of ticks that you would like to have displayed on the y-axis. Note: this is merely a guide and your results will likely vary.

tickFormatY.desc: Provide alternate formatting for the y-axis tick labels.

dataFormatX.desc: A method to pre-format the input data for the x-axis before attempting to compute a scale or draw.

dataFormatY.desc: A method to pre-format the input data for the y-axis before attempting to compute a scale or draw.

sortX.desc: Provide a method to custom-sort x-axis data. Must be a valid array comparator, returning -1, 0, or 1.

unsupported.desc: A callback method that will be invoked if SVG is not supported in the viewer's browser.

arguments.selector: the selector used for this xChart's constructor

empty.desc: A callback method invoked when the data set provided was empty and there is nothing to draw.

arguments.selector: the selector used for this xChart's constructor

notempty.desc: The opposite of <var>empty</var>. Invoked if the data set provided was not empty.

arguments.selector: the selector used for this xChart's constructor

timing.desc: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to transition during draw/update.

interpolation.desc: Line interpolation to use when drawing lines. See d3.js's line.interpolate for more information.

setData.desc: Change the data that for this chart and animate from the current display to the new data.

data.desc: See Data Format for format and more information.

setType.desc: Change the vis type for this chart and animate the display.

type.desc: The vis type to force the main data to display with. If not provided, will use the last set vis type, or the one provided at xChart creation time.
Scale type to use along the y-axis (vertical).

xScale.desc: Scale type to use along the x-axis (horizontal).

yScale.desc: Scale type to use along the y-axis (vertical).

xMin.desc: Minimum allowed value on the xScale. If null, uses the data's min value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales.

xMax.desc: Maximum allowed value on the xScale. If null, uses the data's max value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales.

yMin.desc: Minimum allowed value on the yScale. If null, uses the data's min value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales.

yMax.desc: Maximum allowed value on the yScale. If null, uses the data's max value, logically padded for aesthetics. Does not affect ordinal scales.

type.desc: The vis type to force the main data to display with. If not provided, will use the last set vis type, or the one provided at xChart creation time.

main.desc: An array of data sets to be drawn.

comp.desc: An array of data sets to be used as comparisons to the main data set. This set differs from <var>main</var> in that each set must have its own independent vis type

preUpdateScale.desc: Executed before the scales have been created for the given data sets.

arguments.scaleData: The union of the main and comp data sets

postUpdateScale.desc: Executed after the scales have been created for the given data sets.

arguments.scaleData: The union of the main and comp data sets

enter.desc: As the first draw step, enter is used to create any elements that we need and bind the data information to each element.

arguments.storage: A persistent object specific to this vis type for you to store data for later retrieval.
arguments.className: A set of CSS classNames, dot-separated, that are recommended to be appended to the main element of this vis.
arguments.data: The data that should be used for drawing this vis.

update.desc: During update, we loop over every element and transition its appearance, based on any changes that may have been made to our data series.

arguments.storage: A persistent object specific to this vis type for you to store data for later retrieval.
arguments.timing: Time, in milliseconds, for running transitions.

exit.desc: Called as the last step of updating a vis, in this method we hide any visual elements that are no longer being usedâ€“elements from a previous data series that no longer exist in the new series.

arguments.storage: A persistent object specific to this vis type for you to store data for later retrieval.
arguments.timing: Time, in milliseconds, for running transitions.

destroy.desc: In the last step of our vis, we remove all displayed elements. This method is most called when xChart is instructed to change vis-types for the entire chart.

arguments.storage: A persistent object specific to this vis type for you to store data for later retrieval.
arguments.timing: Time, in milliseconds, for running transitions.
